title: Former deputy leader of SNP says Nicola Sturgeon is wrong to call for indyref2 next year
text:
A former deputy leader of the SNP has called on “whoever is in government” in Westminster to reject Nicola Sturgeon’s demand for a new Scottish independence referendum next year.

In an apparent reference to Alex Salmond’s expected trial in the new year, Jim Sillars said every journalist, MSP and MP knew that 2020 would be “the worst time for a referendum campaign led by the SNP”.

He claimed the First Minister was either being “foolish” in demanding indyref2 next year or was “engaged in a cynical exercise in manipulating the emotions of activists”.
